intro: Porterandia rarissima, commonly known as the rare starflower, is a strikingly beautiful plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple, typically in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and grows in rocky, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is known for its resilience in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Porterandia rarissima is considered a rare and endangered species.
